topic.title: Exercise: solv006 - Vitamins for cattle feeding

section.p: A farmer uses three types of cattle feed, type 1, type 2 and type 3. The nutritional composition and the cost per kg of each type is displayed in the following figure.

A magazine has published the minimum day requirements (MDR) in milligrams per animal for the vitamins A, B and C. These are 120 mg A, 180 mg B and 100 mg C. Furthermore, an animal can not eat more than 7½ kg of type 1 and 5 kg of type 2 and 2½ kg of type 3.
How many kilos of each type should the farmer provide every day to get the costs as low as possible and still meet the minimum day requirements?

section.title: Answer
section.p: Per day: type 1 = 7.500 kg, type 2 = 1.397 kg and type 3 = 1.426 kg. Costs = $68.37.
